instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message: The other day I got in an 820-00840 that shows 20V .5A on the USB-C dongle but has no image. I can see the backlight is on but nothing  on screen. No signs of liquid damage. When I plug in the charge I do get an audible tone like when plugging in an iPad. Trying to decide if this is an image problem or a no booting problem.

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message:
Confirm if has USB activity.
Also check external video.

Should be good to test known good compatible LCD assembly too...

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message: Client mentioned they tried to plug external monitor and got nothing. I will try USB activity.

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message: So I took the logic board completely out and put the machine back together and it turns on and is running. Not sure what the hell I did but it is working. Weirdest thing.

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message: Spoke too soon. While the board seems ok the screen looks great, when I close the display just enough for the screen to turn off and reopen it, the screen goes blank but can see backlight is on. I have to restart the machine to get the image to show up but it comes back every time. Seems like a worn out display cable to me.

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message:
(Already) classic flex issue from Apple.
Check if can be replaced by Apple free.

threads.title: 820-00840 no image
threads.message: Found that the right ribbon cable is what is causing screen to turn off.
